section.title: Purpose of this work
section.para: The purpose of this work was to provide a 3 dimensional visualization of a map from an XML file. his map stores information about places and metro lines of a town, which should be displayed in an appropriate way.

section.title: Our goals
section.para: Our goal was to implement a program that parses this map and generates the data structures, displays metro lines as colored polygons on a plane, adds houses on this plane randomly but checks for "collisions" with metro lines, provides useful mouse and keyboard support such that changing the viewport (zooming, rotation, different centres) should be possible (easily). Moreover different light settings should be implemented, existing features such as the shortest path algorithm, visualized and extended.

para.title: 4 EM EiffelMedia Library:
para.para: Provides the Components for doing the whole graphics stuff (e.g. Access to the SDL commands or the widgets that were used for the GUI).

para.title: 5.TRAFFIC Library:
para.para: Provides the whole map parsing, datastructures and things like the calculation of the shortest path.

section.title: Structure of documentation
section.para: The next part explaines the overall structure and all the used classes and factories with their features in detail. Part three gives information about all the dependencies between the different classes. Besides it explaines which parts are depending on the information in the XML files and which features would have to be changed using a different one. Part four concentrates on the reuse of the MAP class and factories, using a different scene. It explains how options are set using the apropriate features and what would be to do going beyond changing only the scene. Finally, part five presents some ideas of what could be implemented in the future and how to embed it into the project.
